definition: to put one's hand to it/to start out on a task/to set out
(chess) move/trick/all right!/(dialect) to add
aspect particle indicating action in progress
to make known/to show/to prove/to write/book/outstanding
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
to wear (clothes)/to contact/to use/to apply
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
think of the big picture, start with the little things (idiom)
pinyin: da4 chu4 zhuo2 yan3 , xiao3 chu4 zhuo2 shou3

definition: empty-handed
with one's hands clasped behind one's back
lit. set out and it becomes spring (idiom); to effect a miracle cure (of medical operation)/to bring back the dead/once it starts, everything goes well

sentences.english: " Our daughter waved and said, "Good-bye, Minnie .
sentences.chinese: 女兒也揮著手說，“再見了，米妮。”

sentences.english: Jonas finally caught his father's eye and waved.
sentences.chinese: 喬納斯終於與爸爸四目交接並揮著手。

sentences.english: He was standing in the cold wind, rubbing his hands.
sentences.chinese: 他在寒風裏不停地搓弄著手。

sentences.english: Astronomers watched the sky to see if they could find a new, faraway planet.
sentences.chinese: 於是，天文學家開始著手尋找這顆未知的行星。

sentences.english: The inner treatment pays attention to whole body in accordance and starts from syndrome differentiation and treatment method.
sentences.chinese: 內治法從整體觀念著手，以辨證論治爲依歸。

sentences.english: And I hope you're holding hands by new years eve.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你能過著手牽著手的除夕夜。

sentences.english: As soon as everything was ready, they started spudding in.
sentences.chinese: 當一切就緒後，他們立刻著手打井。

sentences.english: I have never traded FX and I do not know how to start.
sentences.chinese: 我從沒有外匯投資經驗，應該從何著手瞭解外匯？

sentences.english: I do not know whereto begin.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道該從哪裏著手。

sentences.english: Shall we with the planned investment?
sentences.chinese: 我們著手絕行有計畫的味厥好埋？

sentences.english: He set out to beat all the other competitors.
sentences.chinese: 他著手去打敗所有其他競爭者。

sentences.english: He began with a study of the features of the old and new existing facilities.
sentences.chinese: 西扎便從調查這裏新舊設施的特點開始著手。

sentences.english: As part of the plan, they had to begin with the engineering design for the tracks throughout the city.
sentences.chinese: 按照計畫，首先要著手進行整個城市鋪軌的細部設計。

to be occupied with (doing sth)
eager to/in a hurry to
to inquire into/to ask after
to have one's eyes on (a goal)/having sth in mind/to concentrate
busy with
to catch and hold on/to continue/to go on to do sth/to follow/to carry on/then/after that/subsequently/to proceed/to ensue/in turn/in one's turn
afterwards/following/later/after
to consider past cause and future effect (idiom); to think over the past and future/to ponder over reasons and connection
as for/as to/to go so far as to
to follow after/immediately afterwards
evidence
to concentrate one's attention completely (idiom)/with rapt attention
to inquire into/to ask after
back/behind/rear/afterwards/after/later/post-
the rear/far behind the front line
